dialogues.text: (joking darkly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitant)

dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.text: To keep authorities in the dark, I often spoke in code.  Rocket launchers were "mothers", the rockets "children".  Assault rifles were "apples".  The AK-47 was "the Angel King".

dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.text: Do we run?

dialogues.text: We have to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get that fucking rag down! The CREWMAN hastily complies.  Yuri's call is answered. YURI (cont'd) (trying not to sound too desperate)

dialogues.text: It's Yuri.  I need another handle for this tub...something in our weight class. (to an elderly Latin PAINTER, pointing to the stern)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now! The terrified PAINTER makes for the stern where he's hurr winched over. Yuri returns to the phone call. YURI (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it's got to check out...you got a shorter name!...what?--Kono?  How do you spell that?...K-O-N-O.  That's good! He hangs up. YURI (cont'd) (to the PAINTER, already blacking out the name, KRISTOL)

dialogues.text: Kono!  K-O-N-O. The PAINTER, nods nervously from his precarious perch, st paint. Yuri sneaks another look through his binoculars.  The Cus is closing fast. YURI (cont'd) (back into phone)

dialogues.text: It's my brother, Yuri.  He's my big brother. Yuri stares at the cocaine map.

dialogues.text: What the fuck is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ukraine. (indicating the direction he is going to snort)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I start in Odessa, work my way to the Crimea--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at the map, appalled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --You'll be fucking dead before you reach Kiev. Yuri opens a window, the cocaine blows off the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fuck! Vitaly freaks out, slams the window so hard it shatters. Hookers still don't rouse.) VITALY (cant'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking fuck! Vitaly desperately tries to snort the cocaine out of the carpet - the straw constantly clogging with carpet fibers Blood oozes from Vitaly's nostril.  Yuri gazes down at hi brother. EXT.  ST. JOSEPH'S DRUG REHAB CLINIC.  DAY. An exclusive rehab center.  A title appears: YURI's car pulls up outside, Vitaly in the passenger seat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of the car. Vitaly doesn't budge. YURI (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promised our parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitaly, you're going to have a good time. This is a top place.  Two Ford models checked in last week and that cute weather girl's been here since July.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Yuri relents, pours a gram onto the dashboard.  Vitaly sn the dash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he wipes his nose)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good brother. Vitaly kisses Yuri. Two ORDERLIES open the car door, escort Vitaly away. Yuri watches his brother in the rearview mirror - shepher path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never understood what separated the recreational drug user from the habitual, the functional addict from the dysfunctional.  But for the grace of God, it could have been me snorting lines as long as the Belt Parkway. INT.  CATHOLIC CHURCH - BRIGHTON BEACH.  DAY. IRINA lights a candle in front of the Virgin Mary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitaly never got completely clean despite the prayers of my mother... INT.  SYNAGOGUE - BRIGHTON BEACH.  DAY. ANATOLY prays in front of the menorah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and father.  In fact, my younger brother was the only reason my father ever had to question his new religion. INT.  AIR MAROC JETLINER.  DAY. An EXECUTIVE sits in his Business Class seat.  On the tra front of him, calculator and spreadsheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After Colombia I became a one-man-operation. A sole proprietor as you say on your tax return - that is if you're foolish enough to fill one out. He exchanges a collegial smile with YURI who has similar entrepreneurial paraphernalia in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By then I'd mastered my craft.  Selling arms is not so different to selling vacuum cleaners.  You advertise, pound the pavement, take orders. The businessman's smile dissolves when he catches a glanc brochure lying next to Yuri's "Day-Runner" - glossy photo GRENADE LAUNCHERS.

dialogues.speaker: SCENES
dialogues.text: It takes place in an unidentified country in North Africa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, a good arms dealer also has to be a political scientist.  I go by a seven-step approach. YURI gets off a plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One: identity a government and an opposition where the opposition is ignored. YURI immediately picks up a newspaper, eager for the late

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two: Wait for a radical group to break away from the opposition. YURI is buoyed by the front page news, over-tips the NEWS SELLER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three: Immediately approach the radical group and offer them arms. YURI meets a group of REVOLUTIONARIES in a backstreet bar them an arms catalogue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four: Whether they buy or not, inform the government that the radical group approached you and offer the government arms. YURI meets a GOVERNMENT OFFICIAL in the parliament buildi him the same catalogue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five: Whether they buy or not, re-approach the radical group and offer them more arms but now at a higher price.  Increasing tension is a means of generating demand and the ideal situation is to sell to both sides. YURI meets the REVOLUTIONARIES a second time in the same time they are more enthusiastic and Yuri has his calculat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six: If they start shooting at each other, the escalation is underway. YURI, now accompanied by bodyguards, is escorted into the buildings, where he's given a fat envelope. Back at the bar, YURI is given an even fatter envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are consuming small arms and ammunition and the cash register is well and truly ringing. YURI stands at his hotel window, sneaking a look through venetian blinds.  A street battle is taking place. However, in Yuri's mind the sound of the gunshots is grad replaced by the sound ot a cash register.  Each time a gu the register rings. Yuri shuts the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven: Don't forget that the success of a radical group in one country can inspire a radical group in a neighboring country. Yuri boards a plane, taking off for a new conflict zone. INT.  AIR MAROC JETLINER.  DAY. YURI leans back in his Business Class seat - eyes closed. suddenly blink open.  He feels someone watching him. Sure enough, he is face-to-face with AVA CORDOVA - starin from a magazine cover in the seat pocket next to him. INT.  MODEL AGENCY.  DAY. A gallery of MODELS from the late-eighties on VOGUE, HARP BAZAAR, ELLE magazine covers, blown-up and framed on a wh An AGENT with a window-office overlooking Park Avenue tal phone.  In front of her, the headshot of AVA CORDOVA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --There's really no one else you'd consider? Christie and Brooke are both available...not the right look?  It's just that Ava doesn't generally do print. The agent examines an envelope stuffed with cash. AGENT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: However, since you are willing to double her rate and pay cash in advance.  She loves working with Herb and you say the campaign will only be seen in Asia? (examining a first class plane ticket Destination: St. Barts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I certainly can't see her objecting to the location. (inspecting an itinerary)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is the product again...? INT.  ARMS SHOW CONVENTION HALL.  DAY. YURI talks on a phone as he browses at an arms show.  He display of handguns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The product?  Er,...Colt .45. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beer. INT.  EDEN ROCK HOTEL - ST. BARTHELEMY, FRENCH CARIBBEAN. An idyllic beachfront hotel. AVA CORDOVA enters an empty reception area.  The RECEPTIO her a fax - Ava's face falls. YURI sits by the deserted pool, observing her entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It cost me twenty for the fake booking, another twelve to buy out the hotel.  You can't force someone to tall in love with you but you can sure make ita damn sight easier. INT.  HOTEL RESTAURANT.  DUSK. A large restaurant overlooking the ocean. AVA and YURI are the only guests, both eating alone.  The contact - exchange polite smiles. EXT.  PRIVATE BEACH.  DAY. AVA strolls down to the beach, deserted, save for YURI - some distance away on one of the hundred empty sunbeds. Ava dives into the water.  Behind his sunglasses, Yuri wa

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Towelling off on a sunbed of her own, Ava glances over to seems crazy not to speak to each other.  Ava breaks the i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling to Yuri)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Popular hotel, huh? Yuri smiles.  Ava approaches, extends a hand. AVA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ava Cordova.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yuri Orlov.  What brings you to St. Barts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A photo shoot.  At least, that was the plan. But the photographer's plane got stuck in Miami.  Hurricane - though there was nothing in the news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gazing out at the ocean)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those things can come out of nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The job's cancelled and there's no flight back to New York 'til Tuesday. Yuri pretends to ponder her predicament.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can hitch a ride with me if you like. Ava regards him cautiously - likes what she sees. YURI (cont'd) (picking up his own camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the meantime, why don't I take your picture? Ava smiles, poses playfully for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my experience some of the most successful relationships are founded on lies and deceit.  Since that's where they usually end up anyway, it's a logical place to start. EXT.  ST. BARTHELEMY AIRPORT.  DAY. A limousine approaches a Lear jet parked on the tarmac of runway airport.  YURI and AVA exit the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I nearly went broke trying to convince her I was anything but.  I knew Ava was not the kind of woman to be seduced by a ride in a private jet unless you owned the jet. CLOSE ON the tail of the jet - the name "ORLOV AIR".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding her skirt in the wind to protect her modesty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your plane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is my name. They enter the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I was lying.  The plane was a rental, like the car and even the suit I was standing in.  At the last minute, I bribed the crew for the paint-job. As the plane picks up speed on the runway, the name "ORLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luckily, by the time we landed, Ava wasn't looking anywhere but in my eyes. INT.  LEAR JET.  DAY. YURI and AVA sit beside each other on a white leather sof customized cabin drinking Cristal champagne. Yuri glances through Vogue magazine - a photo spread on A takes in the plane's sumptuous appointments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pretending to be impressed with the photos)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had no idea. He hands her back the magazine. YURI (cant'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I didn't recognize you.  You must think me very rude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't apologize.  I put on clothes for a living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wry grin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least you aren't taking them off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling at his irreverence)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would be if half the photographers had their way. (shrug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I can't complain.  I'm paid to say, "Cheese". (meeting his gaze)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing so glamorous.  I'm in transport - international air freight mostly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, like UPS or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glance to her champagne flute)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Business is good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you, I can't complain. They both drink.  A thought occurs to Ava.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if you did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...I don't know. (reluctant admission)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just that I travel all around the world but I can't help feeling sometimes that I'm going nowhere. Ava regards him closely.  He's echoed her thoughts.  Yuri another drink. YURI (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's to... (raising his glass)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a hurricane. They toast. YURI (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without it, I'd never have met you. She meets his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is no accident, is it, Yuri? Yuri freezes - doesn't answer. AVA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It feels like fate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (never averting his eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe in fate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you believe in? Yuri gazes at her a moment - he answers her question with Ava does not pull away. INT.  LEAR JET - BEDROOM.  DAY. CLOUDS rush by the faces of YURI and AVA, heads close to oval windows. They make love in a wall-to-wall bed built into the rear The camera moves past the couple through one of the plane and the clouds begin to rain. EXT.  ISRAEL CENTRAL TEMPLE - BRIGHTON BEACH.  DAY. Confetti.  YURI and AVA run through the paper shower as t the steps of a synagogue in Brighton Beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We married in a synagogue to make my father happy.  In the eyes of my Catholic mother, it was worse than living in sin. Yuri and Ava kiss his parents, ANATOLY and IRINA. As the happy couple reaches the limousine, VITALY - out o out of his mind - fires an AK-47 into the air as a salute The GUESTS drop to the ground - the only ones left standi and Vitaly. Yuri stares daggers at Vitaly, helps Ava to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (explaining to the guests)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's traditional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meekly echoing the remark -joke badly misfired)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traditional. The guests nod, uncertain. YURI (cant'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more time, Vitaly. Vitaly lets go another burst. YURI (cont'd) (reassuring word as he whisks Ava into the car)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  I should have said something. INT.  UPPER EAST SIDE APARTMENT.  DAY. YURI carries AVA over the threshold of their new home to the assembled GUESTS. ANATOLY and IRINA gape in amazement at the grand house. their son aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touching his yarmulke)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always remember, son, there's something above you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up, gently joking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Dad.  A forty-thousand dollar crystal chandelier. Anatoly forces a smile.  Irina presses a gift into Yuri's YURI (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, we don't need anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need this. Irina takes Anatoly's arm, they walk away. Yuri, alone for a moment, opens the package - a small Rom Bible, conveniently bookmarked at the Ten Commandments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A newborn baby boy, NICOLAI, plays in the wrapping paper gifts beneath an extravagantly-decorated Christmas tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was still living way beyond my means, mortgaged to the hilt, using one credit card to payoff another.  Anything to keep Ava in the style to which she had, thanks largely to me, become accustomed.  Then suddenly all my Christmases came at once. A family Christmas - Anatoly, Irina and Ava open gifts. wriggles on a blanket, trying to reach a piece of tinsel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Irina, regarding a nativity scene on a Christmas card)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus was Jewish.  You're worshipping a Jew. Irina ignores him.  She regards a gift - a silver goblet Tiffany's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ava, this is too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yuri likes to spoil you. Nicolai crawls an inch.  AVA beams proudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicki!  You did it.  Good boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my grandson. Ava looks around for Yuri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yuri.  Don't you want to see what your son is doing? No reply.  Ava wraps the piece of tinsel around the baby' A loud shout from the other room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tak!  Tak!  Tak-fucking-tak!  (subtitle: Yes!) Ava scoops up the baby.  With Anatoly and Irina, they go investigate. On the television, MIKHAIL GORBACHEV, is making his famou officially ending the Cold War. Yuri kneels in front of the TV as if it is an altar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over!  It's over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cold War, the Soviet Union, the Evil Empire.  Mikhail's saying "no mas".  He's throwing in the towel.  It's over. Yuri kisses Ava, Nicolai, Anatoly, Irina, kisses the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice. (referring to Nicolai)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your son is crawling. Yuri's too busy kissing Gorbachev's birthmark. He gazes at the TV, revelling in the plan taking shape in

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: In the living room, AVA and IRINA play with NICOLAI.  YUR ANATOLY drink Johnnie Walker Black label.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (contemplating the day's events)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least there'll be religious freedom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'll go back for a visit. (trying to sound casual)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you stay in touch with Uncle Dmitri?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (face lighting up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dmitri Volkoff?  Now and then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The luckiest man alive.  You know he was one of the first men at Chernobyl.  Off-duty, at his daughter's wedding, he was roaring drunk.  He was the only one who survived. Later they found that alcohol in your blood resists radiation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still a General in the army?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Major General.  He got promoted.  Two of his rivals were also there that day.  I told you - he's the luckiest man alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He may be luckier than you think. Yuri goes to pour himself a drink.  Anatoly grabs his son way he did many years earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lowering his voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not fools, Yuri.  What's between you and your wife is your own business but I don't think you're going to Odessa to open a McDonald's. (meeting his son's eye)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this how you want to be remembered?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're only remembered when you're dead. Yuri knocks back his vodka, tries to lighten the mood. YURI (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bring you back some caviar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not kosher. A crash.  VITALY and a call-girl, ANGEL, dressed in a low dress, stumble through the front door - both the worse fo drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry fucking Christmas! Angel laughs.  The family gazes at Vitaly and his friend,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (paternal)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitaly, who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her name really is Angel.  She's a fairy. (hoisting Angel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's stick her on top of the Christmas tree. Vitaly and Angel laugh.  No one else does. Vitaly collapses on the floor.  Nicolai cries. VITALY (cont' d) (at a loss for anything better)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you all. Yuri firmly escorts Angel to the door and pays her off. EXT.  ST. JOSEPH'S DRUG REHAB CLINIC - UPSTATE NEW YORK. YURI drops VITALY back at the exclusive rehab center. By now Yuri knows the routine.  He pours a gram onto the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going back to Ukraine. Vitaly snorts it off the dash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (maudlin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss Odessa.  I miss you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss you too. Vitaly kisses Yuri. VITALY (cont'd) (meeting his brother's eye)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful, Yuri.  Those things you sell, kill... (tapping Yuri's chest where his heart should be)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...inside. Two ORDERLIES open the car door, escort Vitaly away.  Yur after Vitaly. INT.  UPPER EASTSIDE APARTMENT.  DAY. AVA and NICKI kiss YURI goodbye. EXT./INT.  PUBLIC STORAGE FACILITY - MANHATTAN.  MORNING. YURI enters a public storage facility, opens a locker wit combination lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no problem leading a double life. It's the triple and quadruple lives that get you in the end. He produces several passports from the locker, shuffles t passports like playing cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back then I carried a French, British, Israeli and Ukrainian passport and a student visa for the U.S., but that's another story. The locker also contains five identical briefcases - pres can tell them apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I also packed five different briefcases depending on the region of the world I was visiting. EXT.  BORDER CHECKPOINT - IZMAYIL, UKRAINE.  DAY. Light snow falls.  YURI, driving a brand new Mercedes, wa long line of cars at the border.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The end of the Cold War was the beginning of the hottest time in arms dealing.  The Wall had fallen.  The arms bazaar was open. Those forty-five years had generated the highest weapons build-up in history.  The Soviets had tanks and guns coming out the demon hole - huge stockpiles and now no enemy. A Border Guard approaches Yuri's car window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in English, checking Yuri's passport)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visa? Yuri hands the Guard his passport.  Inside, a credit card emblazoned, "VISA". The guard smiles. BORDER GUARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash or check only. Yuri smiles, hands him several U.S. bills.  Yuri's passpo promptly stamped.  He is waved past the line of cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to be home. EXT.  ODESSA MILITARY BASE.  DAY. YURI, briefcase in hand, meets his Uncle DMITRI at a barr Dmitri always carries a hip flask of vodka as if there is threat of radiation poisoning.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nephew, come here and hug the luckiest man alive. The General gives him a great bear hug.  Dmitri registers apprehensive look on Yuri's face. DMITRI (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Did you think I'd be glowing?  Don't worry.  You can't catch it. Yuri kisses Dmitri on the cheek to reassure him.  Over hi Dmitri notices the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to the car)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the SLK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 0 - 60 in 4.8. Dmitri is impressed. INT.  ODESSA MILITARY BASE - OFFICE.  DAY. YURI has a stack of VCR's, cartons of cigarettes, Johnnie Black Label on the table in front of DMITRI who drinks fr flask throughout the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't just sell you government property, Yuri.  I have to report--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Report to who?  Moscow?  As of last week Moscow is in a foreign country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New flag, new boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no new boss yet.  They're too busy squabbling over who gets the presidential holiday home at the Black Sea. Dmitri can't deny it. YURI (cont'd) (talking like an evangelist)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful.  The ones who know don't care any more.  The ones who care don't know. (nodding to a safe built into the floor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me your inventory. Dmitri hesitates, knocks back his vodka, then opens the s produces a document. INT.  ODESSA MILITARY BASE - ARMORY.  DAY. Crates of machine guns from floor to ceiling.  DMITRI giv tour of the armory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many Kalashnikovs do you have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to the inventory in his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking over Dmitri's shoulder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a "4"?  It doesn't look like a "4" to me.  It looks more like a "1".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (missing the point)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's a "4".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's whatever we say it is because no one else knows the difference. Dmitri finally gets it.  Yuri examines a Kalashnikov. YURI (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10,000 Kalashnikovs for a battalion.  Your stocks are dangerously depleted, Dmitri. You should order more from the factory. This is too much for Dmitri.  He stops, confronts Yuri - the AK-47 Yuri is inspecting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone will work this out, Yuri.  What happens then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
