dialogues.text: I had heard of the "Boy Brigades", "Small Boy Units", "Kalashnikov Kids".  The theory was that a bullet coming from a fourteen year old is just as effective as one trom a forty year old. ANDRE BAPTISTE haggles with YURI as he inspects his troop from twelve to fourteen.  Yuri, averts his eyes from the uncomfortable reviewing soldiers a head shorter than he. OLDER SOLDIERS fill the ranks behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't pay your asking price, Yuri.  We are not a rich people and the market is already flooded with your Kalashnikovs.  In some places you can buy one for the price of a chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't just look at the unit price.  You forget the ancillary costs.  End user certificates need to be forged and notarized, shell companies set up, insurance purchased, pilots and crews hired.  Not to mention the bribes.  You can't get a nut and bolt out of the Eastern bloc without a bribe.  There's one bribe for the nut. Another for the bolt.  This is an expensive proposition. Andre interrogates Yuri's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I pay in timber...or stones. Baptiste produces a handful of uncut diamonds from his po widen at the sight of the very precious stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (regarding the stones)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take the stones.  It's hard to get a tree trunk in my hand luggage. Andre smiles.  He turns to his new Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to the inspection)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very professional, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dismissing the troops)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dismissed! Yuri and Andre watch the troops disperse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're planning a new offensive.  If you delay a week I can get you the armored personnel carriers we talked about.  They would give you a significant strategic advantage. Andre nods, grateful for the free tactical advice - regar a new light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say I am the lord of war.  But perhaps it is you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (correcting him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not "lord of war".  It's "warlord".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it my way. Andre smiles again.  They are going to be fast friends. He leaves Yuri alone to examine his uncut diamonds in his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diamonds are far less bulky than hundred- dollar bills.  You can get a million dollars into a cigarette box. EXT.  ART GALLERY - MANHATTAN.  DUSK. A GO-BETWEEN emerges from a gallery with a wrapped painti YURI, waiting in a limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the mid-nineties, my wealth had caught up to my lies about my wealth - even surpassed the lies. Yuri pays the Go-Between in cash, places the painting in INT.  LIVING ROOM - NEW YORK APARTMENT.  NIGHT. YURI enters the front door, drops his luggage at the door AVA, talking excitedly on the phone, hangs up, runs to gr VITALY, in the background, cocktail in hand, with another looking GIRLFRIEND, is examining another of Ava's paintin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yuri, I just got off the phone with the dealer.  I sold my first painting. Yuri and Vitaly greet each other with a nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feigning surprise)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fantastic.  Who bought it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone important.  They want to remain anonymous. (asking in a way that does not expect an answer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was your trip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know.  Same old, same old. (quickly changing the subject)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Nicki, in bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  Poor darling.  He tried to stay up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll kiss him goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opening champagne)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This calls for a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What doesn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still giddy at the news)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My first painting.  I'm officially an artist! He watches Ava showing off more of her paintings to Vital latest girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured I was a patron of the arts and of everything else Ava had tried and failed at after modelling.  Acting, her own cosmetics line.  I didn't sabotage her careers but I can't deny it was convenient for me in maintaining a low profile.  She was a beautiful bird in a gilded cage. INT.  BEDROOM - NEW YORK APARTMENT.  NIGHT. YURI kisses his sleeping son, NICOLAI, now three years ol He places a gift at the end of his bed - an expensive-loo microscope. At the same time he spies an object in Nicolai's toy box gun. INT.  KITCHEN / LIVING ROOM - NEW YORK APARTMENT.  NIGHT. YURI tosses the toy gun in the trash. VITALY, still in the kitchen, catches him - pretends he d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you, brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, still the resident family fuck-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone has to do it. They watch Ava in the living room sharing a joke with Vit girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knows, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't talk about it. Vitaly looks askance. YURI (cont'd) (shrug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many car salesmen talk about their work, how many executives at cigarette companies? And both of their products kill more people every year than mine.  At least mine has a safety switch.  If those guys can leave their work at the office, why can't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, you're good.  You almost had me convinced. (to his girlfriend, knocking back his drink)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going, baby.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Yuri and Ava are alone at the window, overlooking Central hands her a fresh glass of champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raising his glass for a toast)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Manet, Monet...and Ava Cordova. Ava grins, goes to drink when she notices two huge diamon laying at the bottom of the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasp)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yuri!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trip went better than expected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fishing out the damp baubles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yuri, they're beautiful. (flirtacious grin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what am I going to wear them with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flirting back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know just the outfit. They kiss. INT.  BEDROOM - NEW YORK APARTMENT.  NIGHT. CLOSE UP on the diamonds dangling from AVA's ears.  She w earrings and nothing else as she and YURI make love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know how much she knew and how much she ignored.  I was a good provider and as far as she was concerned - loyal.  Despite the other women, I always made love to Ava as if she was the only one. INT.  HELICOPTER - MANHATTAN.  MORNING. From an unmarked helicopter, JACK VALENTINE and his INTER shadow a Mercedes sedan as it weaves through midtown traf INT.  SEDAN.  MORNING. YURI rides in the back seat of the sedan, scouring the wo sections of several newspapers. A thought interrupts his homework. He opens the sunroof a crack, spies the helicopter tailin He closes the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the DRIVER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take Park. EXT.  PARK AVENUE.  MORNING. The sedan enters the underpass beneath the Helmsley build moment the car hidden from aerial surveillance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Driver)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is good. The Driver pulls over, never coming to a complete stop be bails.  Horns blare at the illegal drop-off. YURI (cont'd) (to the Driver from the sidewalk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take them on a tour of the Tri-State. Yuri grabs Ava's painting from the trunk and the sedan pu out into daylight minus Yuri - the occupants of the helic the wiser. Yuri hails a taxi. INT.  HELICOPTER - MANHATTAN.  MORNING. VALENTINE observes the sedan cruising through the heart o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where in God's name is he going?  Is he lost? INT.  PUBLIC STORAGE FACILITY.  MORNING. With some reverence, YURI props Ava's painting against th his private sanctuary, then goes about his business - shu passports, deciding who he will be. EXT.  NEW YORK APARTMENT.  DAY. AVA, dressed in a robe, all smiles, pours herself a cup o She sips the coffee at the window, glances down. In the courtyard below, INTERPOL AGENTS are picking throu garbage cans under the supervision of AGENT VALENTINE.  V curiously examines the toy gun. The smile is wiped off Ava's face.  She makes brief eye-c Valentine before stepping back from the window. Slightly shaken, she picks up the phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitaly...it's Ava. INT.  COCKPIT - ILYUSHIN-76 CARGO PLANE.  DAY. The cargo hold of an Ilyushin-76 cargo plane.  It's so ov with weapons, many are strapped into the passenger seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was now the best merchant of death alive.  I didn't own my own plane.  I owned a fleet - running guns into Liberia, Sierra Leone or the Ivory Coast at least once a week. Unfortunately, my friends at Interpol were also starting to find West Africa on the map. Most trips I had phoney paperwork.  If the deadline was tight, I had no paperwork at all. In the cockpit, an American PILOT and CO-PILOT keep an id their instruments as they fly over the endless plains of Leone.  YURI sits in the jump-seat, reading the Wall Stre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his co-pilot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Even taking into consideration the pay-off to the parents, a week with a girl in Burkina Faso is cheaper than a night with a girl in Jersey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus, they're cleaner--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and a lot of them speak better English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Personally, I prefer a language barrier-- An unmarked military jet appears through the starboard wi voice on the radio is familiar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Charlie, Echo, India.  Descend for landing on heading zero...two...nine. The Pilot picks up the radio, looks to Yuri.  Yuri shakes dialling his satellite phone.  Yuri's call is answered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone, trying not to sound too desperate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Southern, it's Yuri.  Sorry to call you on this number but I've got an Interpol jet and-- The jet outside the window falls back. INT.  A PENTAGON OFFICE.  DAY. A mid-rank office dominated by a computer terminal.  We l COLONEL SOUTHERN's shoulder.  He is admiring a new medal. IN SUITS sit opposite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone, measured voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't know you right now.  It's not a good time. Southern hangs up. INT.  COCKPIT - ILYUSHIN-76 CARGO PLANE.  DAY. YURI, hearing the response, explodes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gaping at the phone in disbelief)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a good time! Suddenly machine gun fire strafes the Ilyushin - bullets through the fuselage, perilously close to Yurirs very com cargo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker! The jet appears again at the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Charlie, Echo, India.  Comply immediately. That was your last warning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where was the first fucking warning?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rock your wings if you intend to comply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Yuri, anxious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm putting us down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You land and we're all going away!  I don't have paperwork!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in a flying fucking bomb!  They're firing bullets at our bullets!  Forget about going away!  They shoot again, we're going away for good!  I'm putting us down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knowing he's right)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay!  Okay!--Fuck!! The pilot responds on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Charlie Echo India.  Descending on heading zero two nine. The Interpol jet takes the lead towards a small airport. terrain below, getting his head back in the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing out a narrow highway)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the airport.  There.  The highway.  It's our only fucking hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pothole could set us off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't underestimate yourself.  You're the best, Tony. The pilot doesn't buy it but reluctantly changes course a INT.  INTERPOL JET.  DAY. From his own wingseat, VALENTINE observes the Ilyushin's landing on the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't land there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the pilot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't get far.  I want a truck waiting on the tarmac. EXT.  HIGHWAY.  DAY. A heavily-trafficked highway.  WOMEN carrying water jars heads, a thin COW pulling the carcass of a car, VENDORS s meat, CHILDREN playing war games. The pedestrians look up to see the lumbering Ilyushin mak final approach - they scatter. The Ilyushin weaves on landing, hits a bone-jarring potho INSIDE THE PLANE - boxes of grenades, bullets and other m jump dangerously up and down. Finally, the Ilyushin pulls up safely on the highway, eng shutting down.  YURI's head appears out of the cockpit wi Curious LOCALS, recovered from the shock, are gathering a of the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the pilots, sizing up the locals)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to be okay. The PILOTS are already halfway out of the plane door, gra supplies as they go. YURI (cont'd) (calling out from the window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As far from the evidence as I can. The pilots start running down the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, you idiots!  There's not going to be any evidence!  Stay with the plane! The pilots ignore him - run for their lives. YURI is left alone.  He turns a lever marked, "CARGO BAY" EXT.  CARGO BAY.  DAY. The rear cargo bay opens.  YURI stands beside his incrimi merchandise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the gathering locals)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help yourselves.  Be my guest.  No charge. One LOCAL MAN tentatively approaches the cargo bay.  Yuri an AK-47 and a box of shells. More SIERRA LEONESE LOCALS emerge from the side of the ro seemingly out of thin air. Yuri hands out more guns. YURI (cont'd) (to other locals)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the whole crate. Two men oblige, ferrying the crate away. The other locals become bolder, then brazen. Soon it's a free-far-all.  Men, women and children swarm the plane pilfering the arms and anything else that isn't down - also a lot that is. Yuri has to exit the plane to avoid being trampled in the EXT.  HIGHWAY.  DAY. YURI buys a Fanta from a vendor - exchanging it for a box grenades. He sits on a soda crate for a front row seat at the chaos Yuri has a calculator out - totalling his losses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering under his breath, shutting off the calculator in disgust)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a fucking disaster. Yuri sees the pilot seats being stolen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, not those!  You don't touch the plane! (plaintive moan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the fucking seats... Glancing up the highway, Yuri sees an approaching cloud o VALENTINE and two truckfuls of heavily-armed Interpol Age Too late.  The last of the guns and ammunition are being on the back of a thin cow. Valentine's truck fishtails to a halt beside the stripped Valentine is first off the trucks and into the plane's ca empty. Other INTERPOL AGENTS fan out - futilely questioning loca Miraculously the weapons have vanished into the bush. Valentine calls out to the last fleeing local - a BOY wit lifevest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you! The boy stares back, defiantly inflates the life preserve VALENTINE (cont'd) (exasperated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. The entire cargo has gone.  An errant bullet falls off a the plane and rolls down the floor - Valentine picks it u YURI sits innocently on his soda crate. A frustrated African Interpol Agent, MBIZI, wound-up by t rushes Yuri - slams him to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You run from us. (flashing a machete in Yuri's face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you run with no legs? Valentine rushes over, pulls Mbizi off Yuri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Mbizi.  No, no, no. Valentine drags Mbizi out of Yuri's earshot.  Mbizi still piece of Yuri - Valentine preventing him getting to the g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me disappear him, Mr.  Valentine.  He is a devil.  Let me disappear him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look where we are.  Who will know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will. Mbizi stops struggling against Valentine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn your back, Mr. Valentine.  I will go to hell to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (to his Agents)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find the pilots. Mbizi and another Agent reluctantly head off in a truck. Valentine returns to Yuri who is dusting himself off.  Va handcuffs Yuri himself, picks up the soda crate and sits on it. VALENTINE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've spent my whole career on the right side of the line.  You're the first man I've encountered who makes me seriously consider crossing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the charge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing in Sierra Leone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on safari.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to the bullet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting wildebeests with submachine guns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you with the park service?  Hunting without a license - is that the charge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're trafficking arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trading.  But without evidence who can say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trade or traffic, you make a fortune by keeping the poorest people on the planet killing each other. (hesitates, unsure whether to waste his breath - wastes it anyway)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know why I do what I do? Yuri remains handcuffed, sitting on the soda crate - dwar cargo plane.  Valentine paces beside him. VALENTINE (cont'd) (ignoring him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are more prestigious assignments, you know.  Keeping track of the nuclear arsenals.  You would think it more critical to world security.  It's not.  Nine out of ten war victims today are killed by assault rifles and other small arms - like yours. Those missiles just sit in their silos. Your AK-47 - it's the real weapon of mass destruction. Yuri regards his interrogator curiously.  Despite the sun down, he feels obliged to give him his version of the fac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want people dead, Agent Valentine. I admit, a shooting war is better for business.  But I'd prefer people to fire my guns and miss.  Just as long as they're firing. He regards Valentine with something approaching pity. YURI (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realize the unspeakable things that are done with my weapons.  I also understand the unspeakable things that are done with Williams Sonoma carving knives and Wilson baseball bats and they aren't taking those off the market any time soon.  People will always buy guns.  Why not mine? Valentine appears to have no answer. YURI (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I go?  You've got nothing on me-- (unable to resist)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --but cuffs. Now Valentine smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am legally permitted to hold you for twenty-four hours without charging you. Yuri looks away, knows where this is going. VALENTINE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may ask, why do I bother to do that?  I can assure you, it is not because I enjoy your company.  And you may be surprised to learn that it is not for any vindictive motive.  No. The reason I delay you for every second of the permissible twenty-four hours, is that I am delaying your deadly trade and the deaths of your victims.  I don't think of it as taking a day from you but giving a day to them.  Some innocent man, woman or child somewhere has one more day on this earth because you are not free. Valentine looks to his watch. VALENTINE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you in twenty-three hours and fifty five minutes. Valentine walks away.  Yuri is left to ponder the notion. We see time lapse photography of Yuri waiting out his twe hours, under armed guard on the highway - stretching his eating a suspicious-looking sandwich, going to the bathro arcing across the sky - all the while his plane is being cannibalized by the locals.  Finally the time lapse slows real time. Valentine returns in a Jeep with Mbizi and other Agents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be pleased to know your colleagues were no more co-operative than you. Valentine opens the back of the Jeep.  Lying in the back, of the two PILOTS shot and stripped. VALENTINE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The locals got to them before we could. Yuri turns away from the sight.  His handcuffs are remove Returning Yuri's documents, Valentine notices a photo of NICKI in the wallet. VALENTINE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handsome family. Valentine and the Agents get back in the truck and drive EXT.  HIGHWAY.  DUSK. YURI starts to walk down the deserted highway alone - his plane is now just another carcass in the jungle. A CONVOY of armored personnel carriers barrels past him - U.N. white.  The lead car slams on its brakes, bringing t a stop.  A woman pokes her head out of the window - CAPTA CARLISLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleasantly surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yuri!  Yuri Orlov!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giving her an embarrassed hug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (approaching the window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know.  Fighting the good fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An aid program?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yes.  In fact, I've just had some transport problems.  You couldn't give me a ride to Monrovia, could you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  Climb in. Yuri steps back into a vehicle with which he is very fami VIVIAN (cant' d)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're pulling out.  It's too dangerous. It's a shame.  We were really doing some good things. Yuri nods in understanding. INT.  HOTEL AFRICA - YURI'S HOTEL ROOM.  NIGHT. A weary YURI enters his room.  Sitting on the green sofa gagged, face reduced to pulp, silver hair matted with blo SIMEON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!  Simeon! ANDRE JNR., a FLUNKY and his CHEERLEADERS appear from beh door, laughing at his shocked reaction. YURI (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre!  What in heaven is he doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gift for you. Yuri stares into the old gunrunner's terrified eyes. ANDRE JNR. (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got here just in time.  I was afraid he would die before you got a chance to kill him. He offers Yuri a Beretta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you think informed on you - cost you your plane?  He came to meet my father, hoping to take your place. Yuri spits on Simeon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stupid old fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knowing smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He killed your man when he tried to kill you. Andre again offers Yuri the Beretta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want us to let him go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  No.  I... Andre offers him the gun a third time.  Yuri refuses it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you do want him dead.  You just don't want to kill him yourself?  I understand. Andre grabs Yuri and presses the gun into Yuri's palm, cl own hand over Yuri's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll do it together.  A bonding experience. Andre forces Yuri's finger onto the trigger as he aims at terrified Simeon - eyes pleading. Yuri attempts to pull his hand away but Andre is too stro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can stop if you want - but you do.  Just say the word. Andre stares at Yuri not Simeon. ANDRE JNR. (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, "stop". Yuri opens his mouth but no word comes.  Andre presses Yu onto the trigger. The gun goes off.  A splash of blood across the sofa's gr upholstery. The gunshot echoes around the room.  Simeon is very dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop. Andre smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surveying the blood-spattered room)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get you another room with a nicer view. INT.  HOTEL AFRICA - LIBERIA.  DAY. YURI collapses on the bar - gestures to the BARMAN who im pours a line of cocaine in full view. YURI hoovers it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I started doing a lot of cocaine in West Africa.  I wasn't medicating myself.  I was simply playing catch-up.  I was constantly dealing with people who are chemically imbalanced without the aid of chemicals. It's just a matter of etiquette.  It's rude to act sane in a room full of lunatics. The Barman nods to a patron at a corner table - a SEASONE - no more than eighteen years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bought you "brown-brown", Mr. Yuri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wiping his nose)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Brown-brown".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mixture - cocaine and gunpowder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does the gunpowder do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's magic.  They give it to the small boys before battle - they do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some other time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to try it at least once, Mr. Yuri. The Barman starts chopping another line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's your gunpowder. Sure enough the Barman pours the gunpowder from one of Yu shells into the cocaine. The SEASONED FIGHTER, assault rifle slung over his should intimidating air, sidles up to Yuri - stares him down.  Y option, does a line. He washes it down with a swig from a vodka bottle, raises to the fighter. The Barman puts on a Ukrainian folk song.  Yuri picks out PROSTITUTES in the bar, starts dancing. He drunkenly dances with one PROSTITUTE after another - t almost violent, the prostitutes flung aside, none lasting a few seconds - caught in the arms of the other PATRONS. To Yuri, the bar swims before his eyes. The music stops.  Yuri, wild-eyed, looks at the stunned b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to no one in particular, whipping his vodka bottle off the bar)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going for a walk. EXT.  MONROVIA.  NIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: SCENES FROM YURI'S P.O.V. IN HIS ALTERED STA
dialogues.text: MIXTURE OF FORMATS INCLUDING SUPER-8 & VIDEO, SHAKY H FOOTAGE, OVER-EXPOSED FOOTAGE, BLACK & WHITE FOOTAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YURI staggers towards the edge of town - still swigging f bottle.

dialogues.speaker: A ROOM WITH A CURVED CEILING ON THE OUTSKIRTS OF MONROVIA
dialogues.text: YURI, eyes unable to focus, stares at a WOMAN'S FACE in f him, moving back and forth.  The gyrating stops. Yuri realizes he is lying in the mouth of an enormous cem his back, a prostitute on top of him.  She gets to her fe adjusting her dress. Yuri panics, hurriedly zipping himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a mixture of French and English)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't fuck you, did I?  Did I fuck you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in French, as she counts Yuri's money)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not what I would call a fuck. The prostitute tosses a couple of bills back to him.  Yur the money, staggers after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sick? She ignores him. YURI (cont'd) (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sick?! Yuri staggers to his feet - wanders aimlessly across a fi

dialogues.speaker: A DANCE IN DUST SOMEWHERE ON THE OUTSKIRTS OF MONROVIA
dialogues.text: Two dozen pairs of feet chase each other on a dirt field from a crowd.  The dust clears, revealing a bundle of clo string doubling as a soccer ball.  The game is between tw indistinguishable teams of MONROVIAN YOUNGSTERS on a make field, goalposts constructed from tree branches lashed to YURI wanders onto the field, joins the game without askin players humor him by letting him have the ball. Yuri dribbles up field, takes an enormous swipe at the ba completely, clattering to the ground. The crowd and players laugh.  The game goes on.  Yuri, al but in a far more desperate manner, picks himself up and away.

dialogues.speaker: A LIBERIAN BAR CALLED "ZANZI-BAR"
dialogues.text: YURI throws up at the back of a saloon flimsily construct rusted corrugated iron. Rinsing out his mouth with vodka, he is distracted by the two little GIRLS arguing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask the foreigner.  The foreigner will know. The GIRLS approach Yuri - no older than seven, formal whi hands politely behind their backs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, will my fingers grow back? One of the girls shows Yuri a healed stump where her hand Yuri runs away.

dialogues.speaker: A MODERN SCULPTURE SOMEWHERE IN MONROVIA
dialogues.text: YURI passes in front of an abstract arrangement of holes out to be a building pock-marked with gunshells. Suddenly a FACE appears in one of the holes - SIMEON.  Th wound in his forehead still evident.  Yuri gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simeon. Simeon turns and walks away - revealing a large exit woun of his head. YURI (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simeon!! Yuri pokes his head through the hole but Simeon has vanis turns back to find himself trapped by TWO MEN in flip-flo Gap T-shirts and AK-47's. Through Yuri's eyes the two men look like four.  The two/ through Yuri's pockets, take his watch, shoes. Yuri is oddly compliant - clumsily helping one of the thi the watch. One of the men, tired of Yuri's antics, aims his gun at Y His colleague stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't.  He's Andre's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keeping his gun raised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck Andre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seemingly beyond caring)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, fuck Andre. The man fires at Yuri.  The gun jams.  Yuri looks almost disappointed.  The man tries again.  Again the gun jams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to the gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  They don't usually do that.  Let me have a look.  Maybe I can fix it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgusted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off! The man whips the gun across Yuri's face.

dialogues.speaker: A PATH OUTSIDE MONROVIA
dialogues.text: YURI, face streaked with blood and dirt, wanders aimlessl the brush outside Monrovia. A HYENA appears on the dirt path in front of him - teeth frenzied eyes. Yuri stares at the wild dog - starts to quietly cry.  Tea down his cheeks. The hyena runs away.  Yuri is alone.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MONROVIAN DOCKS. DAWN.
dialogues.text: A vacant-eyed YURI sits in the shadow of an enormous stac unloaded from a freighter. A presidential motorcade appears on the dock.  ANDRE BAPT emerges out of his Mercedes Jeep, gun in his hand.  He st Yuri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yuri, you fucked up!  I am going to shoot your face off with your own gun. Yuri doesn't flinch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unfazed, regarding the man)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad.  Andre's latest double? The man's face falls.  The real ANDRE BAPTISTE emerges fr ANDRE JNR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Yuri, standing beside his uncanny double)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's too eloquent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no heart. Baptiste brandishes a copy of the New York Times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen the news?  They accuse me of rigging elections, but after this in your Florida with your Supreme Court of kangaroos-- CLOSE ON the headline, "U.S. SUPREME COURT REVERSES RECOU ANDRE BAPTISTE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --now the U.S. must shut up forever. Yuri just smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More good news.  That's the last aid shipment.  The war is so bad, the U.N. is pulling out. Andre shrugs.  He regards the inactivity at the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is nothing happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reluctant to give his father bad news)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No trucks.  They are trapped on the front lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are trucks.  You just have to get all that food out of them. Yuri gestures down the dock where food is being loaded in marked, "HUMANITARIAN AID" Andre Baptiste and Andre Jnr.  are clearly taken with the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Killing certain humans can be considered humanitarian. (thinly disguised reference to the previous night)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that right, Mr. Yuri? Andre Baptiste hands Yuri his payment - a slim briefcase a pouch of uncut diamonds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After surviving the last few days I'd started to feel like I was invincible.  But there was a weapon that could hurt me. INT.  UPPER EAST SIDE APARTMENT.  DAY. From behind the cover of a sofa NICOLAI shoots at an unse finger as the gun. The camera pans around the room to find AVA in an armchai AGENT VALENTINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hush, Nicki. (to Valentine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe you. Valentine is unfazed. AVA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you prove any of it?  Where is your evidence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hoping you could help us with that. (opens an old file containing a copy of a newspaper clipping, headlined, "Cordova Disappearance" )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand your parents died tragically in EI Salvador. (meeting Avars gaze)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That regime has startling similarities to several of the regimes supplied by your husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out. Valentine rises to leave.  Ava holds Nicolai, her mind re INT.  FASHION SHOW - NEW YORK.  NIGHT. Impossibly thin MODELS strut along a transparent lightbox runway, flanked by SOCIALITES and PAPARAZZI. Projected on the wall behind them, the words, "FASHION AG - Dress Not To Kill" and various images from the world's Each outfit is enthusiastically applauded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now, one of the sponsors of tonight's evening, former Miss World, Ava Cordova. AVA appears from behind the wings in a designer gown.  Sh accepts the applause - gradually becomes aware of a proje her face. She turns to see the projected image of a CHILD holding a When she turns back, tears are rolling down her face. INT.  NEW YORK HOUSE.  NIGHT. Back to us, AVA naked, sits on the end of her bed, clothe beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ava? YURI, still carrying his suitcase, appears in the doorway the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ava, what's wrong?  Where's Nicki?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still with her back to us)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's with your parents. Yuri senses something very wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why aren't you dressed?  I thought we were going out. He finds a robe from the closet - gently places it around pulls it off her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning back to look at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't wear the clothes.  I can't wear the jewelry.  I can't drive the car.  I can't live in this house.  Everything1s got blood on it. Yuri pulls the robe back onto her shoulders, walks to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be so melodramatic. Ava pulls the robe to her, follows Yuri to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I'm melodramatic.  I'm a failed actress, remember?  We need to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  We never have before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we do. Yuri notices the Interpol business card on the bedside ta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These people - you can't trust them--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --I've talked to your parents.  Why do you think they don't want your money?  They know where it comes from.  We all know. Yuri sighs, resigned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sell people a means to defend themselves, Ava.  That's all.  I don't hold a gun to any one's head and make them shoot--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Yuri, I see the news.  Sierra Leone--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --I don't sell machetes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --What do you think is pointing at the victims when they use those machetes?  I see the pictures.  Yuri, the guns are bigger than the boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing illegal about what I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care if it's legal, it's wrong. Ava meets his eye. AVA (cont' d)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can accept the drugs.  I can even accept the other women.  I can't accept this. Yuri looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It makes no difference if I stop.  Someone will take my place the next day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let them.  We have enough.  You're not that little boy in Odessa anymore, lining up for a loaf of bread--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --It's not about the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? He doesn't answer - perhaps he doesn't have one.  Ava loo the window at their expensive view. AVA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like all I've done my whole life is be pretty.  All I've done is be born.  I'm not just a failed actress.  I'm also a failed writer, failed artist, failed businesswoman.  I'm not much good as a mother.  Come to think of it, I'm not even that pretty any more.  I've failed at everything, Yuri. (turning back to him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I won't fail as a human being.  I'm leaving. The words finally register with Yuri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't leave.  I'll stop. (as if trying to convince himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll stop. Ava is skeptical.  He holds her, reassures her. YURI (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been thinking about it for a while.  A lot, lately. (as if trying to convince himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm making more from the oil and timber anyhow. (further reassurance)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll stop. She interrogates his eyes for the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleading eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will?  You promise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadly serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (changing the subject a millisecond too fast)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now get dressed.  We'll go out. Ava picks up the dress off the bed. Yuri gazes at her. YURI (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, you're wrong about not being pretty any more. She turns back and smiles. EXT.  FIFTH AVENUE AT CENTRAL PARK EAST.  DAY. A YOUNG INTERPOL AGENT, carrying a tray of coffee, approa plain panel van parked outside Yuri's apartment building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the next month I stopped running guns. I went legitimate. The van door opens to reveal VALENTINE and other INTERPOL wearing headsets, monitoring a scanner device.  The agent porn to keep themselves amused - except Valentine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wonder Valentine was confused. INT.  UPPER EAST SIDE APARTMENT.  DUSK. YURI toys with his old BULLET pendant as he talks on the For once the spreadsheets in front of him deal with oil a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God there are still legal ways to exploit developing countries. With the cordless phone to his ear, Yuri wanders to the k tosses the pendant down a trash chute. Back in the den, Yuri punches a calculator as he continue call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the only problem with an honest buck is they're so hard to make.  The margins are too low.  Too many people are doing it. Finally we are privy to the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Impossible.  Two and a quarter?  I can't make a profit at two and a quarter.  Why don't you take my oil and I'll fucking pay you? Yuri hangs up, stares down from his apartment window. Valentine's panel truck drives away.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Night has fallen over Central Park - criss-crossed by a n lights.  Yuri continues to stare out of the window. He is perplexed by the sight of a diplomatic motorcade pa his building. Before he can make sense of it, the house phone rings. AVA enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yuri, the President of Liberia is in the lobby. Yuri, stunned for a millisecond, recovers with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glance to his watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's early. INT.  LOBBY - UPPER EAST SIDE APARTMENT.  DAY. ANDRE BAPTISTE is admiring his new uniform in a gilt edge ANDRE JNR. is flirting with two TEENAGE GIRLS - residents building.  The perplexed DOORMAN stares at the motorcade door - flashing lights on the police escort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the girls)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --You should come to Liberia with me tomorrow.  It is beautiful this time of year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liberia.  Is that on Long Island? YURI, ashen-faced, hurriedly exits the elevator into the lobby - strides up to Andre Snr.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yuri!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous as hell)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing here, Andre?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hugging Yuri)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here for the peace talks at the U.N.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling him out of earshot of the curious Doorman, anxious whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So at the same time you thought you'd drop in on your arms dealer?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you still are?  You're a hard man to get hold of all of a sudden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --But now you mention it, we are doing a little shopping while we're here - that is if you open for business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxious look past Andre to the motorcade on the street)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've got to be watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disdainful shrug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course they blame me.  They always blame me.  They are on a--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unable to resist)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --hunt for a witch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a smile, for once correcting Yuri)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Witch-hunt".  But I have been granted diplomatic immunity due to the escalation in hostilities. (conspiratorial)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is why I need you.  They are making life difficult to re-supply.  It will require a man of your unusual ingenuity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help you.  I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. He shakes Yuri's hand firmly. ANDRE BAPTISTE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you should know that our present difficulties compel us to be unusually generous. Yuri realizes that Andre has placed a huge uncut diamond hand. ANDRE BAPTISTE (cont'd) (hugging Yuri)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farewell, Lord of War.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still haven't brought me the gun of Rambo. Andre Baptiste and his son breeze out of the lobby. INT.  UPPER EAST SIDE APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM.  NIGHT. YURI enters, sits in an armchair.  AVA and NICOLAI are cu the sofa - Ava reading him a fairytale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up from the book)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that about the oil or the timber?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both.  Everything. Ava smiles, carries on reading. Yuri looks to his hand - we rack focus to the uncut diamo gets up. INT.  UPPER EAST SIDE APARTMENT - GARBAGE ROOM.  NIGHT. YURI, still in his suit, stands in a dumpster, searching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At four and a half months a human fetus has a reptile's tail - a remnant of our evolution. Amongst a pile of rotten food he finds his necklace conta BULLET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can fight a lot of enemies and survive but if you fight your biology you always lose. Yuri places the bullet around his neck. INT.  NEW YORK APARTMENT.  MORNING. AVA is fastening eight-year-old NICOLAI's coat, readying YURI, half-dressed, appears in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, not even waiting to say goodbye?  I'm leaving in ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Nicki has swim practice. Nicolai kisses his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Papa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hugging him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you, big guy. Ava kisses Yuri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teasing him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Personally, I'm glad you're going.  You've been here so long you're starting to get on my nerves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking the teasing good- naturedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This oil concession should be wrapped up by Thursday.  I'll be back for the weekend. We'll go somewhere - the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be fun. A thought occurs to Yuri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You trust me, right? Yuri's turn to interrogate her eyes.  Ava smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looked me directly in the eye the way I've looked in the eyes of a thousand customs officials, government bureaucrats and footsoldiers from every law enforcement agency in the world - and she lied without flinching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I trust you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'd learned from the best. Ava gives Yuri a final kiss, hurries Nicolai out the door INT.  MERCEDES SEDAN.  DAY. From the rear seat of a Mercedes sedan we observe YURI ex apartment building and entering a waiting Mercedes sedan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the DRIVER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him. We reveal AVA and NICOLAI in the car.  Yuri's car pulls a Ava's car follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going, Mama?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like hide and seek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. EXT.  PUBLIC STORAGE FACILITY.  DAY. YURI locks his storage locker, observable from the street the facility carrying a passport and briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can always sense when I'm being tailed.  I know what to look for.  But then I'd never been tailed by the woman I love. Returning to his car, Yuri fails to notice that AVA has w his routine from her own car. Instead of following the car, Ava exits with Nicolai. INT.  PUBLIC STORAGE FACILITY.  DAY. AVA, NICOLAI in tow, approaches Yuri's locker. She tries a combination - fails.  Tries another - fails. same result.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can put myself in Ava's place.  She might have understood if the combination was the last four digits of my social, my birthdate, even her birthdate but not Nicolai's. Ava looks to Nicolai, tries one more combination, relucta CLOSE ON the numerals on the lock - "10...6..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My son's birthday unlocked what the government would later describe as, "a catalogue of carnage". "90".  The lock opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whisper, to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that.  Not that, Yuri. Ava opens the storage room door - at first struck by the of her paintings inside the locker.  Shaking the image fr head, she turns her attention to the briefcases and other She shuffles through the passports in horror - different Yuri, different names: "George Eagleman", "Georges D'Aigl is her husband?  Is he any of them? INT.  "THE CRIMEAN" RESTAURANT - DAY. VITALY is back at work in the kitchen of the family resta YURI approaches - Vitaly senses something amiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to see how the other half lives?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss your borscht.  Mom and Dad say you're clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too.  They said you went legitimate - hard to believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because it's not true. Vitaly is hardly surprised. Yuri glances to his parents, ANATOLY and IRINA, at the re counter, folding napkins - observing their two sons. They avert their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only you know.  I'm leaving tonight - on a job.  I want you to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.  I'm thinking of opening my own place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe this trip will help.  It's good money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking to his parents)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've given my word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't have to know.  We'll tell them we're going for a little "r" and "r".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you need me all of a sudden?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West Africa's fucked-up. (off Vitaly's look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than usual.  I can't trust anybody.  I need someone to watch my back. The notion touches Vitaly.  Yuri closes the deal. YURI (cant'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Brothers in arms". Vitaly looks to his PARENTS.  They stare at him until he eyes. Vitaly can't refuse his brother. EXT.  HIGHWAY - SIERRA LEONE.  DAY. A fork in the road.  Two large trucks slog through the bu take the left fork. YURI, VITALY and ANDRE JNR. are in the cab of the truck, DRIVER. Andre is admiring his new M60 machine gun with attachable launcher - the gun of Rambo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned by the route)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUF - "freedom fighters". Yuri stares out of the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every faction in Africa calls themselves by these noble names - "liberation-this", "patriotic-that", "democratic-republic-of- something or other".  I guess they can't own up to what they usually are - "federation- of-worse-oppressors-than-the last-bunch-of- oppressors".  Often the most barbaric atrocities occur when both combatants proclaim themselves "freedom fighters". The truck passes a checkpoint marked by two skulls. EXT.  REFUGEE CAMP - SIERRA LEONE.  DAY. A tent city.  A Jeep packed with young, machete-wielding FIGHTERS circles the refugee camp, taunting and terrorizi inhabitants. The mostly WOMEN and CHILDREN are trapped by the circling Whenever a refugee attempts to escape, they are driven ba increasingly manic, shrieking rebels. Yuri's two trucks are parked on the roadway above the cam of the REBELS are massed - a rag-tag mob wearing over-siz carrying machetes and the occasional AK-47. At a small folding table a REBEL LEADER negotiates with Y ANDRE JNR.  The Leader places a pile of uncut diamonds on VITALY is more interested in the camp - observing the cir full of Rebels and their smirking comrades on the highway From a distance, he spies a WOMAN and YOUNG SON make a de for escape from the camp.  Two REBELS, on foot, give chas woman appears to be pregnant. Vitaly watches in horror.  The Woman is quickly overtaken to death.  Then the Boy.  Vitaly can't look, turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. Vitaly comes to a horrific realization. He hurries to Yuri, still negotiating with the Rebel Lead

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yuri, I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (insistent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Rebel Leader)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Vitaly draws Yuri out of earshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated by the interruption)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxious whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't do this deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck we can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to the camp)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look over there.  As soon as we leave, they're going to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (averting his eyes from the camp)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not our business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (protesting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They killed a boy just now - as young as Nicki. Yuri flinches. The suspicious Rebel Leader and Andre Jnr. approach the t brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the hold up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to keep his poise)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no hold up.  I'll be right there. Yuri draws Vitaly further away. YURI (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitaly, it's what we always know - we can't control what they do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today we can.  They're right there - close enough to touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry, impatient)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think they'll do if we back out - they'll kill us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if we go ahead - they'll kill them. The Rebel Leader approaches again - this time he's not le

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is he saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Vitaly realizes the futility of the discussion, backs dow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resigned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  You're right, Yuri.  You're right. (getting his head back in the game)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I hear you say 300 IPG's, 500 assault rifles and 800 grenades?  I thought it was 1,200 grenades.  I'd better check. Yuri pats his brother on the back, returns to the negotia Vitaly heads for the trucks. For once we follow Vitaly.  Andre Jnr. regards Vitaly war INT.  TRUCK.  DAY. The prongs of a hammer on a box of grenades.  VITALY is p the lid. Andre Jnr. appears behind him - M60 poised ominously on h

dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.text: Something for Yuri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step away - slowly. Vitaly closes the lid - a ruse.  He picks up the hammer a sudden, violent motion swings it across Andre's face, sma jaw, teeth flying, Andre's body flopping like a rag doll. He remov the diamonds from the table. EXT.  TRUCK.  DAY. YURI sits in the cab, staring out of the window as the tr away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitaly broke the cardinal rule of gunrunning.  Never pick up a gun and join the customers. The truck turns the bend.  In the background, true to Vit prediction, the rebels descend on the tent village, firin indiscriminately with their new weapons. Yuri hears the sound - we detect a barely perceptible fli INT.  REAR OF TRUCK.  DAY. A lone gun crate, emptied of its contents has been put to VITALY's makeshift coffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffins are hard to come by in Sierra Leone. Demand is so high.  Fortunately, we had a lot of boxes just the right size. EXT.  SIERRA LEONE MARKET.  DAY. "America's Funniest Home Videos" plays on a TV set.  The laughter appears to be almost directed at YURI who is mak distance call on a geriatric telephone. We aren't privy to the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know which is worse, Jewish guilt or Catholic guilt.  My parents were like God's tag-team. We pull back to reveal the makeshift coffin sitting at Yu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I could not deny them the chance to say goodbye to their eldest son. INT.  J.F.K. AIRPORT - CUSTOMS BAY.  DAY. CLOSE ON the screen of an X-RAY machine.  Innocuous overs passes in front of the screen - a surfboard, a double bas crate containing VITALY's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For twenty Monrovian dollars a doctor removed the lead from Vitaly's body and wrote a bogus death certificate.  I should have paid more. The OPERATOR of the machine, stops the conveyor belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've smuggled millions of rounds of ammunition and the bullet that lands me in jail is found under my dead brother's rib. In Vitaly's chest, a bullet. INT.  J.F.K. AIRPORT - CONVEYOR BELT.  DAY. The other oversize items move down the conveyor belt for - YURI waits with two burly PORTERS. No other items are appearing - finally the coffin contain Two ATF AGENTS appear behind Yuri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flashing some ID)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yuri Orlov, we're with the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resigned smile, regarding the insignia on their jackets)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe it or not, I only use the first two. The agents are not amused - handcuff Yuri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have the right to remain silent.  Use it. They march him away. INT.  NEW YORK APARTMENT.  DAY. A phone rings. MANHATTAN CENTRAL JAIL.  DAY. YURI, on a payphone, in the jailhouse corridor, reluctant up.  He makes another call. INT.  "THE CRIMEAN" RESTAURANT - BRIGHTON BEACH.  DAY. ANATOLY, lighting a candle, picks up the phone.

dialogues.text: "Crimean Restaurant".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papa? Anatoly looks at the telephone receiver in his hand - wit another word he passes the phone to IRINA.  ANATOLY walks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both my sons are dead. INT.  INTERVIEW ROOM.  DAY. CLOSE ON a SLUG in an evidence bag tossed onto a table - Agent can scarcely contain his excitement. YURI sits at the small table, stares at the slug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of yours? Yuri doesn't take the bait. Two other AGENTS sit at the back of the room observe the interrogation. VALENTINE (cont'd) (referring to a document)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curiously, the death certificate says he died of heart failure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he did. (referring to the slug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I saw one of those coming at me, l'd have heart failure. The flippant comment gets under Valentine's skin but he k temper in check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We performed the autopsy and released your brother's body to your family.  You tried to do something decent, Yuri.  You went against your nature.  And now it's cost you. (unable to resist)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother's funeral is looking a lot like your funeral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Falsifying a death certificate?  That's not going to hold me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, as usual. Yuri not so cocky now - waits to see where this is going. VALENTINE (cont'd) (putting a copy of the New York Times in front of Yuri)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen today's paper? A front photograph of VALENTINE posing beside Yuri's docu his five BRIEFCASES.  The headline reads, "MERCHANT OF DE Caption - "Catalogue of carnage." VALENTINE (cont'd) (pacing, lauding it over Yuri)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fake end-user certificates, cut-out companies, all meticulously catalogued. There's hardly a dictator, warlord or despot anywhere in the world you aren't on first name terms with. (producing another evidence bag containing Ava's diamond earrings and an engagement ring)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your trophy wife gave us the prize.  She also provided us with these - which we suspect are conflict diamonds. Yuri takes all this in. VALENTINE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has agreed to testify against you. Yuri nods - picks up the newspaper.  But instead of readi his own front page news, he opens the paper, turns to Wor - various items on the warzones at the end of the millenn Yuri reads, takes his time.  Valentine cannot believe his Finally Yuri reacts.  A broad smile - his killer smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This.  Tell me that I am everything you despise, that I am the personification of evil, that I'm responsible for the breakdown of the social fabric of society and world order, that I am a one man genocide.  Say everything you want to say to me now - because you don't have long. Valentine is infuriated by Yuri's casual demeanor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you not paying attention or are you delusional?  You've broken every arms embargo written.  There's enough in those briefcases to buy you consecutive life sentences.  You'll spend ten years going from a cell to a courtroom before you even start doing your time. Yuri is looking away, apparently completely unconcerned. attitude further angers Valentine. VALENTINE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't seem to fully appreciate the seriousness of your situation!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping back - his emotion finally showing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My family has disowned me.  My wife and son have left me.  My brother is dead.  Trust me, I fully appreciate the seriousness of my situation.  But I promise you I won't spend a single second in a courtroom. Valentine laughs derisively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are delusional. Yuri is still unfazed.  He leans forward to close the dea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like you, Jack.  Well, maybe not.  But I understand you.  You feel your loyalty to your badge has finally been rewarded.  But you haven't counted on the people who gave you that badge. Valentine's turn to hesitate. YURI (cont'd) (meeting Valentine's gaze)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me tell you what's going to happen so you can prepare yourself. Yuri nods to the interview room door. YURI (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon there's going to be a knock on that door and you're going to be called outside. A montage of scenes - Yuri's prediction plays out accompa commentary. INT.  INTERVIEW ROOM.  DAY. A knock at the door and an AGENT nods to VALENTINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the hall there will be a man who outranks you. INT.  HALLWAY - JAIL.  DAY. Sure enough, a decorated military OFFICER talks to VALENT hallway as Yuri describes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First, he will compliment you on the fine job you've done, how you're making the world a safer place and then he is going to tell you that I am to be released. We observe valentine's reaction - vigorously arguing with superior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are going to protest, you will probably threaten to resign. The Officer, still turned away from us, tries to calm Val INT.  HALLWAY - JAIL.  DAY. The door to the interview room opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But in the end I will be released. Yuri exits the cell to freedom. We return to the present. INT.  INTERVIEW ROOM.  DAY. VALENTINE's eyes burn into YURI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing to the open newspaper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reason I'll be released is the same reason you think I will be convicted.  I do rub shoulders with the most vile, sadistic men calling themselves leaders today. (referring to the newspaper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But some of those men are the enemies of your enemies. Valentine is starting to get a sick feeling. YURI (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And while the biggest arms dealer in the world is your boss, the President of the United States - who ships more merchandise in a day than I do in a year - sometimes it's embarrassing to have his fingerprints on the guns.  Sometimes he needs a freelancer like me to supply opposition forces he can't be seen supplying.  You call me evil, but, unfortunately for you, I am a necessary evil. There is a long silence.  Then, A KNOCK AT THE DOOR. Valentine and Yuri exchange a look.  Valentine rises from

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would tell you to go to hell.  But I think you're already there. Valentine turns on his heel.  He is at the door when Yuri replies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I'm not?  What if I sleep fine at night?  What if I sleep better than you? I think that's what truly scares you. Valentine doesn't look back, exits.  Sure enough, the Off the hall as Yuri predicted - COLONEL SOUTHERN. EXT.  MANHATTAN JAIL - REAR EXIT.  DAY. As he's ushered into the car, Yuri yet another briefcase. COLONEL SOUTHERN ushers Yuri into the car, hands him yet as the car door closes. INT.  NONDESCRIPT SEDAN.  DAY. YURI rides alone with the briefcase on his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most people are happy just to get out of jail.  I expect to be paid to leave. Yuri opens the case - BALES OF CASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a fool.  I know that just because they need me one day doesn't mean they won't make me a scapegoat the next.  But I was back doing what I do best. EXT.  MANHATTAN.  DAY. The nondescript sedan melts into rush-hour traffic. EXT.  SOMEWHERE IN THE MIDDLE EAST - DESERT CHECKPOINT. A checkpoint in the desert - the fence a literal line in YURI accompanies a convoy of trucks.  He is joking with a OFFICER - back to doing what he loves. The Border Officer inspects the crates in a truck, reads manifest marked, "UMBRELLAS - QTY: 4,040 units".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (skeptical)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Umbrellas - to Saudi Arabia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun umbrellas. Yuri hands the Officer a plain, brown paper bag.  The Off - a wad of cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a safe trip. The Officer waves the convoy through. EXT.  DESERT - BATTLEFIELD.  DAY. The desert where we first found YURI, the aftermath of a speaks directly to camera once again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For someone who's never fired a gun or been in a battle, I have suffered many casualties in my life.  I guess that's how I survived.  I never went to war... His thought is interrupted by a burst of gunfire. YURI (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...especially with myself. Yuri walks away through the charred munitions and black s In the distance the sound of sporadic gunfire.
